name: langrepl
description: Interactive command-line chat application powered by Langchain, Langgraph, Prompt Toolkit and Rich
readme_summary: Langrepl is an interactive command-line interface (CLI) application for building and running sophisticated LLM agents. It leverages LangChain, LangGraph, Prompt Toolkit, and Rich to provide a powerful environment for agent development and deployment.
key_features: Deep Agent Architecture with planning tools, virtual filesystem, and sub-agent delegation
LangGraph Server Mode for running agents as API servers with visual debugging integration
Multi-Provider LLM Support (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, AWS Bedrock, Ollama, etc.)
Multimodal Image Support via clipboard, drag-and-drop, or file paths
Extensible Tool System including file operations, web search, terminal access, and MCP server integration
Skill System for modular knowledge packages
Persistent Conversations with SQLite-backed storage
User Memory for project-specific instructions and preferences
Human-in-the-Loop with configurable tool approval
Cost Tracking (Beta)
MCP Server Support for external tool servers
primary_use_case: Developing, running, and interacting with advanced LLM agents through an interactive command-line interface.
cover_image_prompt: A master craftsman in a bustling workshop, meticulously assembling intricate clockwork mechanisms that represent AI agents. Gears and springs (representing LLM models and tools) are being connected with glowing threads of data. One agent, a small, intricate automaton, is shown interacting with a virtual workbench displaying a file system and a web browser. Another larger agent is depicted as a server rack emitting holographic blueprints. The workshop is filled with subtle technological elements like circuit board patterns on the walls and glowing UI overlays. The repository name 'Langrepl' is subtly etched onto a workbench. The scene is rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a warm, inviting color palette and soft, focused lighting, emphasizing the creation and orchestration of intelligent agents.

name: lsv
description: A configurable command line file browser with preview and key bindings.
readme_summary: lsv is a terminal-based file browser written in Rust, offering a three-pane interface for navigating directories and previewing files. It is highly configurable via Lua and supports rich, ANSI-colored previews from external tools.
key_features: Three-pane navigation (parent/current/preview)
Keyboard-driven UX with multi-key sequences and which-key overlay
Lua configuration for themes, keymaps, actions, and programmable previewer
External command integration for captured output or interactive shells
File operations: add/rename/delete, multi-select with copy/move/paste
Marks for saving and jumping to directories
Display modes for sizes/dates, toggle hidden files
Command palette with suggestions and Tab-completion
Cross-platform support (macOS, Linux, Windows)
primary_use_case: A fast, configurable, and feature-rich file browser for the terminal, enhancing productivity for developers and power users.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, three-part archway representing a portal into a digital forest. The left arch shows a 'parent' view of abstract glowing trees. The central arch, the 'current' view, features a detailed, interactive map with a highlighted path and a cursor. The right arch, the 'preview' pane, reveals a detailed, illuminated blueprint of a selected object from the map, with subtle code snippets and data streams flowing around it. The overall scene is a clean, modern digital landscape with a focus on clarity and organization, rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a vibrant, tech-inspired color palette.

name: EternalVows
description: Lightweight wedding website that you host
readme_summary: Eternal Vows is a lightweight, self-hosted wedding website template that allows users to easily customize and share all their event details through a simple YAML or JSON configuration file. It features a clean design, dynamic background slideshow, and smooth navigation, powered by a Node.js Express server.
key_features: Customizable, self-hosted wedding website template
Config-driven content via YAML or JSON
Dynamic background slideshow
Clean, modern single-page design
Smooth in-page navigation
Optional CI for Docker image build
primary_use_case: Creating and hosting a personalized wedding website with event details, photos, and registry information.
cover_image_prompt: A beautifully designed, open wedding invitation lying on a wooden table. From the invitation, elegant, flowing ribbons of light emerge, transforming into various icons representing wedding elements: a calendar for the date, a map pin for location, rings for couple names, and a gift box for registry. Subtle digital particles drift around the ribbons, hinting at the underlying technology. In the background, a soft, blurred slideshow of romantic wedding photos is visible. The overall mood is warm, inviting, and celebratory. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with soft lighting and a focus on clear, intuitive iconography.

name: howdy
description: üõ°Ô∏è Windows Hello‚Ñ¢ style facial authentication for Linux
readme_summary: Howdy is a Linux facial recognition authentication system that integrates with the Pluggable Authentication Modules (PAM) framework. It allows users to log in, lock their screens, and execute privileged commands using their face, mimicking the Windows Hello experience.
key_features: Windows Hello-style facial authentication for Linux
Integration with PAM for system-wide authentication (login, lock screen, sudo, su)
Support for IR cameras and emitters
Packaged for Debian/Ubuntu, Arch Linux, Fedora, and openSUSE
Build from source option available
primary_use_case: To provide a seamless and secure facial recognition login and authentication experience on Linux systems, replacing traditional password entry.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, friendly robot character with a glowing, friendly face standing in front of a Linux penguin mascot. The robot is projecting a holographic image of a smiling face, which is then being scanned and accepted by the penguin, who is opening a digital door labeled 'Login'. Subtle lines of light flow from the robot's eyes to the penguin's face, indicating the facial recognition process. Small, abstract data particles float around the scene. The background is a clean, modern interface with subtle code snippets visible. The overall mood is secure and welcoming. The art style should be a vibrant, 3D isometric illustration with clear, friendly character designs and a bright color palette.

name: aisheets
description: Build, enrich, and transform datasets using AI models with no code
readme_summary: Hugging Face AI Sheets is an open-source, no-code tool for building, enriching, and transforming datasets using AI models. It allows users to leverage thousands of open models from the Hugging Face Hub or deploy custom LLMs compatible with the OpenAI API specification.
key_features: No-code dataset building, enrichment, and transformation
Integration with thousands of open AI models from Hugging Face Hub
Support for custom and local LLMs via OpenAI API specification
Deployment options: Hugging Face Space, Docker, local development
Data generation scripts using HF Jobs for large-scale datasets
Option to use vLLM for cost-effective inference
primary_use_case: Empowering users to create, enhance, and modify datasets using AI models without writing code, making AI-powered data manipulation accessible to a wider audience.
cover_image_prompt: A whimsical, steampunk-inspired workshop where a friendly automaton is meticulously sorting and transforming raw, unrefined materials (like rough stones and tangled wires) into polished, perfectly shaped data crystals. The automaton uses a large, ornate lever to feed materials into a glowing AI core, and the crystals emerge on a conveyor belt, neatly arranged and labeled. Subtle holographic interfaces displaying simple data flow diagrams float around the automaton. The scene is brightly lit with a warm, inviting glow, emphasizing creativity and ease of use. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, friendly aesthetic, featuring the 'AI Sheets' logo subtly etched onto the automaton's chassis.

name: digler
description: Digler is a tool for forensic disk analysis and file recovery. It's designed to help you unearth lost or deleted data from various disk images and raw devices.
readme_summary: Digler is a Go-based tool for digital forensics and data recovery, offering both a command-line interface and a desktop application. It specializes in analyzing disk images and raw devices to recover deleted files, even across different file systems, and supports custom file scanners via plugins.
key_features: Broad Disk Image and Raw Device Support
File System Agnostic Analysis
Plugin-Based Extensibility
Reporting Capabilities (DFXML)
Post-Scan Data Recovery
Dual Interface Options (CLI and Desktop App)
primary_use_case: Forensic disk analysis and file recovery from disk images or raw devices.
cover_image_prompt: A digital archaeologist carefully excavating a vast, layered digital landscape representing a hard drive. They are using a specialized, glowing scanner that reveals fragmented 'ghosts' of deleted files (represented as shimmering data packets) amidst the existing data structures. The archaeologist is placing these recovered data packets into a secure, transparent container labeled 'Digler'. In the background, a subtle interface shows a DFXML report being generated. The scene is illuminated by the glow of the scanner and the data packets, set against a dark, tech-infused environment. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clarity and a futuristic, yet grounded, aesthetic.
